segments.text: It's a classic kitchen scene, yet so much feels wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman, so caught up in her task, doesn’t see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It angers me that she’s oblivious to the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy climbing the stool could fall any moment!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m surprised he’s even trying to reach into that jar of cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s eager posture adds a touch of sweetness to the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that sweetness is bittersweet, knowing the risks they’re taking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The peaceful garden outside contrasts so sharply with the kitchen mayhem.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only imagine the mess if the boy slips and falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will he crash into those cabinets, or worse, hurt himself?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This moment feels suspended in time, charged with potential disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel helpless watching their innocent play turn into something dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Maybe I’m overreacting, but it’s hard not to worry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Life can change in the blink of an eye, can’t it?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just wish someone would pay attention before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
